main_definition: The act of verifying or examining something, as well as a formal written order to withdraw money from an account.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To examine closely for accuracy, correctness, or quality.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before submitting the report, make sure you double-check your data and calculations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A written document used to transfer money from one bank account to another.
meanings_and_examples.example: I wrote a check for $200 to pay my electric bill.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To stop, or prevent something from happening by taking action.
meanings_and_examples.example: She checked the door lock before leaving her house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A condition that needs attention or improvement.
meanings_and_examples.example: The car's engine check revealed a problem with one of its components.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cross out or cancel something, usually in red ink.
meanings_and_examples.example: She crossed off the wrong answer on her test and tried again.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A measure taken to ensure safety or prevent accidents.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before starting any construction project, always make sure you have all necessary checks in place.
